@:

        Please consider these (2) factors B4 you make any permanent changes in the formats you use. They are as follows:

(1) Its realistic to understand that MANY of the 5,080,409.00 REGISTERED users of TPB may not be able to afford or have access to the Newest or Newer video/audio formats. Some may NEVER be able to.

(2) IF, you do begin to upload in the NEWEST formats to provide the best quality (which is totally understandable). Will you be able and or willing to upload in BOTH the newest formats (h264 in .mkv or mp4 containers) AND in the now "STANDARD" or OLDER formats (DivX, XviD, .MOV in .avi containers)

I'm only speaking for the "Great Silent Majority" (the millions that do not post comments and Guests that cannot post comments) 

Thanks for the UPLOAD, perfect as usual!!

@dlyrrym1111
This happening to be me first post although I have been with TPB for quite sometime. 
Suggestion/my inferences pertaining your concern about formats. 

There are quite a bit of light weight open source players/codecs which would do the playback irrespective of the formats. 
As mentioned by "extremezone" VLC player has it's own libraries and does not  depend on the libs of the OS. XviD, DivX,MKV,H.264,MP4 and couple of new formats which are are being alpha tested is supported by VLC. 

I have downloaded quite a few movies [rare ones] from TPB and I have come across comments about A/V sync issues/A/V quality complaints ... These can be resolved in real time with open source soft players, if the the user take time out to navigate the abundant features available in these players and understanding and resolving is not a rocket science.        

My post is data driven and I am a seasoned technologist in this domain. 

Great going TPB and Thanks for giving me the opportunity for my first post at TPB. Cheers from India ..
